alert.note: Alert for Central Interior (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 27 at 7:02PM AKST until December 28 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Strong winds, with blowing snow, low visibility, and very cold wind chills. East winds gusting to 30 mph. Visibility one half mile or less at times. Wind chills to 40 below. * WHERE...Over Elliott Highway Summits. * WHEN...Until midnight AKST tonight. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions with low visibility in blowing snow and large snow drifts over Elliott Highway Summits. The dangerously cold wind chills to 40 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest winds, lowest visibility and coldest wind chills are over Highway Summits. Most valley areas have much lower winds. Conditions will improve late tonight as winds decrease.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
